High river levels may cause flooding today, 20 December 2025.
River levels are now beginning to fall but remain higher than usual, particularly through Chippenham and Melksham. 
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. 
Some light rainfall is forecast over the weekend, but levels are expected to continue falling. We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue updates as necessary. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:30AM on 21 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: High tides tonight and tomorrow may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible from 19/12/2025. Areas most at risk are Church Laneham to Rampton Road. No further significant rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. River levels at Torksey Gauge continue to rise slowly and pose a flood risk to low-lying areas and roads. Levels will remain high until 28/12/25. This message will be updated after 9:00 AM tomorrow 21/12/25 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road and Sileby Mill road, and farmlands at Cossington, Sileby, Barrow, Quorndon and Cotes. River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge will remain high overnight tonight, 20/12/2025. Further rainfall is forecast tomorrow afternoon and into the evening of 21/12/2025. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 21 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
Levels are falling but remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett. With showers forecast this evening. 
Low lying land and roads are expected to be most affected by flooding. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if the drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. Property flooding is possible above 8.35m. For the latest river and drain levels refer to https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels. 
Refer to Somerset Council’s website for any local road closures. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. And we are pumping and operating the Parrett Relief Channel when river levels allow. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 12:00 PM on 21 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Water levels remain high after the recent heavy rain and may cause flooding today, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected. And showers are forecast overnight. 
Cutts Road floods when the Currymoor Main Drain is above 5.75m, and New Road as this level is above 6.18m. 
There is a risk of water overtopping Haymoor flood storage area and affecting Curload and Stan Moor if this level reaches 8.30m. For the latest river and drain levels refer to https://check-for-flooding.service.gov.uk/river-and-sea-levels. 
River Parrett levels are being managed using the Parrett relief channel. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and operating our pumping stations when river levels allow. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Refer to @TravelSomerset for information on local road closures. 
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 21 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels on Saturday may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 20/12/2025, as a lot of rain (50mm) fell on Thursday. The River Arun at Pulborough has now peaked. The high tide at 11:30 on 20/12/2025 is forecast to be 30cm higher than Friday nights tide. We expect river levels at Houghton Bridge to be slightly higher over Saturday lunch time. items.description: Groundwater flooding in the Cerne Valley
items.message:
High groundwater levels are expected to cause flooding. 
Flooding is expected from the 19th December onwards. 
Groundwater levels in West Dorset remain high. Areas that could be affected include: Charminster and nearby areas. The groundwater level at the Dickley Down borehole has risen to 170m, and is expected to rise over the next few days. Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. Residents may experience inundation of septic tanks and sewer systems. Flooding of roads is expected, and may have become damaged by floodwater.

Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
If you have a pump, make sure it is working and switched on. Think about alternative power sources in case of power cuts . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 24 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Rising river levels are expected to cause flooding this evening. 
Flooding is expected on 20 December 2025 from around 8pm 
River levels in the Mevagissey Stream are high following heavy rain this evening.

Properties and low lying areas will start to flood from around 8pm on Saturday. The main areas of concern are properties and low lying areas around The Close, Willow Car Park, Sunny Corner Car Park, Chapel Square and Market Square. Flood waters may be deep and fast flowing in these areas. 

River levels are forecast to be at their highest between 8:00pm and 10:00pm. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Activate any flood protection products you may have .  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 21 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
